timeline.bodyText: Please check with Tracy to see if he thinks this should be called io.openliberty.ejbcontainer.security.internal or io.openliberty.ejbcontainer.v40.internal.security
timeline.author: tevans78
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ com.ibm.ws.security.javaeesec.cdi=io.openliberty.security.jakartasec.2.0.interna
 com.ibm.websphere.appserver.spi.jaspic=io.openliberty.jaspic.2.0.spi,,"Jakarta Authentication Service Provider Interface for Containers 2.0 SPI ","Jakarta Authentication Service Provider Interface for Containers 2.0 SPI"
 com.ibm.ws.security.jaas.common=io.openliberty.security.jaas.internal.common,,"Security JAAS Implementation","Security JAAS Implementation; Jakarta Enabled"
 com.ibm.ws.security.authentication.builtin=io.openliberty.security.authentication.internal.builtin,,"Security Built-in Authentication Implementation","Security Built-in Authentication Implementation; Jakarta Enabled"
+com.ibm.ws.ejbcontainer.security=io.openliberty.ejbcontainer.security.internal,,"EJB container Security Collaborator internal","EJB container Security Collaborator internal; Jakarta Enabled"

replies.bodyText: @tkburroughs - Any preferences in regards to Tom's comment above?
replies.author: jvanhill

replies.bodyText: @jvanhill No preference; this is not a project supported by my team.  The com.ibm.ws.ejbcontainer.security* projects are supported by the security team, I'd check with them.  From a strictly jakartaee perspective, that seems to be the direction we are headed.  Not sure exactly who on security teams supports these projects, but it appears the last person to modify them was @toshiyamamoto.
replies.author: tkburroughs

replies.bodyText: Since this bundle is not / will not be specific to EJB 4.0, I would rather we leave the version out of it. I will leave it with this bundle name unless someone else has a strong objection / reason to change it.
replies.author: jvanhill
tkburroughs

replies.bodyText: Oh, sorry to bring this up so late, but "EJB" is trademarked, so should probably be changed to "Jakarta Enterprise Bean container".
replies.author: tkburroughs
